natural problem: Find the measure, in degrees, of the smallest positive angle $\theta$ for which $\sin 3 \theta = \cos 7 \theta.$
natural solution: Note that $\cos 7 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta),$ so \[\sin 3 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta).\]If $3 \theta = 90^\circ - 7 \theta,$ then $\theta = 9^\circ.$ If $0^\circ < \theta < 9^\circ,$ then $\sin 3 \theta < \sin 27^\circ$ and $\sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta) > \sin 27^\circ,$ so the smallest positive solution is $\boxed{9^\circ}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * theta) = cos (7 * theta)"
shows  "theta = 9"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the measure, in degrees, of the smallest positive angle $\theta$ for which $\sin 3 \theta = \cos 7 \theta.$ The final Answer is 9^\circ
 ### Proof
 Note that $\cos 7 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta),$ so \[\sin 3 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta).\]If $3 \theta = 90^\circ - 7 \theta,$ then $\theta = 9^\circ.$ If $0^\circ < \theta < 9^\circ,$ then $\sin 3 \theta < \sin 27^\circ$ and $\sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta) > \sin 27^\circ,$ so the smallest positive solution is $\boxed{9^\circ}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * theta) = cos (7 * theta)"
shows  "theta = 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the angle $\theta$ that satisfies the equation $\sin(3\theta) = \cos(7\theta)$. The final answer is $\theta = 9$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes θ :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * θ) = cos (7 * θ)"
and h1 : "0 < θ"
shows  "θ = 9"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the measure, in degrees, of the smallest positive angle $\theta$ for which $\sin 3 \theta = \cos 7 \theta.$ The final Answer is 9^\circ
 ### Proof
 Note that $\cos 7 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta),$ so \[\sin 3 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta).\]If $3 \theta = 90^\circ - 7 \theta,$ then $\theta = 9^\circ.$ If $0^\circ < \theta < 9^\circ,$ then $\sin 3 \theta < \sin 27^\circ$ and $\sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta) > \sin 27^\circ,$ so the smallest positive solution is $\boxed{9^\circ}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes θ :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * θ) = cos (7 * θ)"
and h1 : "0 < θ"
shows  "θ = 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Find the value of $\theta$ that satisfies the equation $\sin(3\theta) = \cos(7\theta)$ for $\theta > 0$. The final answer is $9$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes θ :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * θ) = cos (7 * θ)"
shows  "θ = 9"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the measure, in degrees, of the smallest positive angle $\theta$ for which $\sin 3 \theta = \cos 7 \theta.$ The final Answer is 9^\circ
 ### Proof
 Note that $\cos 7 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta),$ so \[\sin 3 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta).\]If $3 \theta = 90^\circ - 7 \theta,$ then $\theta = 9^\circ.$ If $0^\circ < \theta < 9^\circ,$ then $\sin 3 \theta < \sin 27^\circ$ and $\sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta) > \sin 27^\circ,$ so the smallest positive solution is $\boxed{9^\circ}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes θ :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * θ) = cos (7 * θ)"
shows  "θ = 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Find the real number θ such that the sine of three times θ is equal to the cosine of seven times θ. The final answer is 9.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * theta) = cos (7 * theta)"
and h1 : "0 < theta"
and h2 : "theta < 90"
shows  "theta = 9"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the measure, in degrees, of the smallest positive angle $\theta$ for which $\sin 3 \theta = \cos 7 \theta.$ The final Answer is 9^\circ
 ### Proof
 Note that $\cos 7 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta),$ so \[\sin 3 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta).\]If $3 \theta = 90^\circ - 7 \theta,$ then $\theta = 9^\circ.$ If $0^\circ < \theta < 9^\circ,$ then $\sin 3 \theta < \sin 27^\circ$ and $\sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta) > \sin 27^\circ,$ so the smallest positive solution is $\boxed{9^\circ}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * theta) = cos (7 * theta)"
and h1 : "0 < theta"
and h2 : "theta < 90"
shows  "theta = 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Find the value of $\theta$ which lies in the interval $(0, 90)$ and satisfies the equation $\sin(3\theta) = \cos(7\theta)$. The final answer is $\theta = 9$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes θ :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * θ) = cos (7 * θ)"
and h1 : "θ > 0"
shows  "θ = rad_of (9::real)"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the measure, in degrees, of the smallest positive angle $\theta$ for which $\sin 3 \theta = \cos 7 \theta.$ The final Answer is 9^\circ
 ### Proof
 Note that $\cos 7 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta),$ so \[\sin 3 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta).\]If $3 \theta = 90^\circ - 7 \theta,$ then $\theta = 9^\circ.$ If $0^\circ < \theta < 9^\circ,$ then $\sin 3 \theta < \sin 27^\circ$ and $\sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta) > \sin 27^\circ,$ so the smallest positive solution is $\boxed{9^\circ}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes θ :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * θ) = cos (7 * θ)"
and h1 : "θ > 0"
shows  "θ = rad_of (9::real)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Find the value of $\theta$ in radians such that $\sin(3\theta) = \cos(7\theta)$ and $\theta > 0$. The answer is 9 radians.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * theta) = cos (7 * theta)"
and h1 : "theta > 0"
shows  "theta = 9 * pi / 180"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the measure, in degrees, of the smallest positive angle $\theta$ for which $\sin 3 \theta = \cos 7 \theta.$ The final Answer is 9^\circ
 ### Proof
 Note that $\cos 7 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta),$ so \[\sin 3 \theta = \sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta).\]If $3 \theta = 90^\circ - 7 \theta,$ then $\theta = 9^\circ.$ If $0^\circ < \theta < 9^\circ,$ then $\sin 3 \theta < \sin 27^\circ$ and $\sin (90^\circ - 7 \theta) > \sin 27^\circ,$ so the smallest positive solution is $\boxed{9^\circ}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes theta :: real
assumes h0 : "sin (3 * theta) = cos (7 * theta)"
and h1 : "theta > 0"
shows  "theta = 9 * pi / 180"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: Find a positive angle $\theta$ such that $\sin(3\theta) = \cos(7\theta)$. The final answer is $\theta = \frac{9\pi}{180}$.
